intro: Gymnosiphon pusillus, commonly known as the dwarf gymnosiphon, is a small, flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant produces small, berry-like fruits that contain seeds enclosed in a fleshy aril. It is often found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
